instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-02016: What is 820-02016? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02016</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5v  <SIGNAL>PPBUS_AON</SIGNAL> 1v
threads.message:
5v on charger
PPBUS 1v no short.
all LDO look o.k

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02016</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5v  <SIGNAL>PPBUS_AON</SIGNAL> 1v
threads.message:
Remove F5200 and check <CAPACITOR>C5254</CAPACITOR> voltage.
If still missing, post <CHIP>U5200</CHIP> voltages: pins <SIGNAL>P_IN</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>AUX_DET</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>SMC_RST_IN</SIGNAL>, VDDA/P, <SIGNAL>EN_MVR</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>AUX_OK</SIGNAL>, A/BMON.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02016</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5v  <SIGNAL>PPBUS_AON</SIGNAL> 1v
threads.message:
i get 12.3v on <CAPACITOR>C5254</CAPACITOR> without F5200, but when i put new good F5200 again no voltage on PPBUS and on PPVBAT , no short found
PPBUS without F5200 0.100 PPVBAT 0.300

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02016</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5v  <SIGNAL>PPBUS_AON</SIGNAL> 1v
threads.message: sorry diode mode on PPVBAT is 500 and on PPBUS is 110

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02016</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5v  <SIGNAL>PPBUS_AON</SIGNAL> 1v
threads.message:
Check diode mode to ground on all coils.
Pay atention to <SIGNAL>3V8_AON</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>3V3_S2</SIGNAL>.
Also check at PMUs LDOs.

BTW, check resistance between <SIGNAL>PPBUS_AON</SIGNAL> and all coils too.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02016</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5v  <SIGNAL>PPBUS_AON</SIGNAL> 1v
threads.message:
didnt find something..but! i was injunct 1v to PPBUS to see maybe something will warm-up and yes! it was small cap with tiny crack..i was take it out and now all work!
thanks!
